channel.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
channel.description:
Okay. So I am trying to develop a program that has all off your basic programs in one. And one of the biggest problems I am having is not having any controls set. Since it is a tabbed program, I would rather not have over 100 tabs with different things in each. So I have a form that lets you opt between Txt docs. Webbrowser, RTF, etc. I have it able to create a new tab. but I don't know how to make the the button add say, a textbox inside of that new tab. How would I do this?
Video [URL=http://s725.photobucket.com/albums/ww251/austinsobes/?action=view&current=tabtest.mp4][IMG]http://i725.photobucket.com/albums/ww251/austinsobes/th_tabtest.jpg[/img][/URL]
My forms are named Form1 and Form2. And they go in that order, The bigger form is form1. Smaller is form 2.
And the coding for my form 2 button to add the new tab page is: [code]Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click My.Settings.TabName = Me.TextBox1.Text Form1.TabControl1.TabPages.Add("" & Me.TextBox1.Text + " .txt") Me.Close() End Sub [/code]
Now. What I want to know, is how I would add a textbox Docked in Fill to that tab. Or a Web browser or something docked in Fill mode. Could anybody help?

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @S_I_N_N_E_R S I N N E R
item.description:
@S_I_N_N_E_R wrote:

Sorry? I don’t understand exactly what you’re trying to do

Do you mean something like this?

[code]Public Class Form1
Dim Tb As New TextBox

Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
    Me.Controls.Add(Tb)
End Sub

End Class[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

[quote=“VbCoder, post:5, topic:360011”]Put this in the button (or whatever you want) that should add the new tab & textbox:

Dim intPageNumber As Integer Dim TB As New TextBox With TB .Multiline = True .Dock = DockStyle.Fill .Text = "The text..." End With intPageNumber = TabControl1.TabPages.Count + 1 TabControl1.TabPages.Add("tab" & intPageNumber) TabControl1.TabPages(intPageNumber - 1).Controls.Add(TB)
I think you should be able to figure out what it does…[/quote]

I love you

Read full topic
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

Put this in the button (or whatever you want) that should add the new tab & textbox:

Dim intPageNumber As Integer Dim TB As New TextBox With TB .Multiline = True .Dock = DockStyle.Fill .Text = "The text..." End With intPageNumber = TabControl1.TabPages.Count + 1 TabControl1.TabPages.Add("tab" & intPageNumber) TabControl1.TabPages(intPageNumber - 1).Controls.Add(TB)
I think you should be able to figure out what it does…

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

The TabPages is a dynamic list last time I checked, which mean it’s an array with extra features, like list.Add(object). So if you wanted to access the third tab page, you’d do something like Form1.TabControl.TabPages(2), or however arrays are used in VB. I don’t really remember.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

I’ve already tried that. Since if you saw how my program worked. You would see that I just create a tab on the spot. There is a problem with that. They have no variable. So it’s not like I can say “If TabControl1.Tabpage3” or anything. it’s just a randomly created new page from the user. The only possible way out of this I found is by creating a temperary variable for a permanant variable in the settings. say having Dim TextTab As String Texttab = Textbox1.Text My.Settings.TabName1 = Texttab If Form1.TabControl1.Tabpages.Contains.Text(<Texttab or My.Settings.Tabname1>) = true Then Form1.TabControl1.TabPages.SelectTab End if

I’m sorry for that extremely sloppy and very incorrect code. I’m a great programmer. but I only learned from self experience and advice, so I still rely on the IDE to give me the extra options and mistakes and stuff

But with that coding. All I could see happening would be an infinity loop

Read full topic
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10

item.title: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If you want to add a tab page with controls, you can either:
A: Create an invisible tab control with its own tabs on your main window or something, and then use those tab pages to add rather than a string. This way you can design the tab visually.
B: Create a tab page through code and add controls this way (TabPage.Controls.Add(etc)).
C: Some other way I didn’t think of at the top of my head.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make A control add a Control? VB 8-10
